Changing the outcome of the American Civil War: I would choose to change the outcome of the American Civil War to be a peaceful resolution. The conflict was devastating for both sides and left a lasting impact on the nation. If I could change one thing, I would want to ensure that the war ended without any the loss of life and destruction of property.

Preventing the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand: I would choose to prevent the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary in 1914. This event is widely regarded as the catalyst for World War I, which was one of the deadliest conflicts in history. By preventing the assassination, I would want to ensure that the world was spared the devastation and suffering that the war caused.

Preventing the Holocaust: I would choose to prevent the Holocaust, which was the systematic persecution and extermination of six million Jews by the Nazi regime in Germany during World War II. This event was one of the darkest moments in human history and had a profound impact on the the the the world. By preventing the Holocaust, I would want to ensure that the the the dignity and worth of every human being is respected and protected.

Preventing the Cold War: I would choose to prevent the Cold War, which was a state of political and military tension between the United States and the Soviet Union from 1947 to 1999. This conflict had a profound impact on the world and left a lasting legacy of mistrust and division. By preventing the Cold War, I would want to ensure that the world was able to work together towards a more peaceful and prosperous future.

Preventing the French Revolution: I would choose to prevent the French Revolution, which was a period of radical social and political upheaval in France from 1789 to 1799. This event had a profound impact on the world and led to the rise of Napoleon Bonaparte, who went on to conquer much of Europe. By preventing the French Revolution, I would want to ensure that the world was able to maintain stability and order.
